comment: the professor is good, the class is just very hard if you dont study. the tests are on lockdown browser, and the final is in person. the tests are hard because it is not multiple choice, one mistake will fail u and the tests are usually 15 questions so if u miss one, it can bring ur grade down alot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Honestly this was the easiest class ever and i'm a duel enrolled student. Everything is on ALEXS and there are videos that you are required to watch but I didn't pay attention to them. Tests and quizzes aren't that long and the study guide will cover the things that will be on the test (lockdown + webcam required).
has great communication and there are zoom meetings available that go over tests and homework. just don't procrastinate and try to spread out the work. overall easy class

This class would be fine if the teacher taught, however Aleks teaches almost everything in the class. The tests are ok, but the final was really hard and looked really different than the study guide. If you fail the study guide you automatically fail the class, definitely don't take this class if your a dual enrollment student it will ruin your GPA

This is my second attempt at college algebra, and I've got to say it is way better than the first professor I had. If you are struggling with a topic or topics there are zoom meeting held to go over the material. Overall, the workload was regular, regular weekly homework, 4 exams and the final.

This is the easiest math class I have ever taken. But all the content is given on Aleks. He also posts notes about the content. He reminds you before every assignment, hw, or test is due to make sure you do it. Tests are lockdown with webcam but super easy, fast, and straight from the study guides!

I had him online for math 1111. I honestly never communicated with the professor directly his course was very easy. I was able to work ahead at my own pace. the ALEKS course was very easy with 4 tests and a final. Weekly homework assignments, but they are easy. Does use a camera and lock down browser on tests. Overall easy course.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Ok professor.

I really liked ALEKS program because I was able to do a problem multiple times to see the pattern. I found out the way I learn math is grueling repetition (math is not my favorite subject). I mostly interacted with a SI, which was helpful since it was an online class. The professor was agreeable and always wanted to aid the class to success.

I took his online college algebra course and most of It was through ALEKS so I barely had any interaction with the professor. However, he doesn't assign lots of work and he drops your lowest test grade and replaces it with the final which is the only reason I passed since I'm horrible at algebra. Overall great class!

If you get the chance to take this teacher, DO IT!! He definitely wants his students to do well. The homework helps with the tests and he will extend due dates if you ask! He gives you test reviews, which help a lot and he provides extra help if needed. The only thing I did not like was how the tests require lockdown and webcam! TAKE HIM!

A wonderful course! One of my favorite things about Professor Holtzendorff is how accessible he is outside of class. He provides ample opportunities (virtual office hours, SI sessions, etc) for students to ask questions and study. Super helpful! He definitely wants you to succeed.

Math is generally a very hard subject for me but prof holtzendroff made it a lot easier. He provides videos to help understand the material and goes out of his way to host study sessions multiple times weekly. I had problems with my anxiety during a test and he was very understanding. He truly does care for his students and wants them to succeed.

Professor Holtzendorff's class was very easy. He would assign homework on ALEKS and give you videos to do your homework. He would give you a whole week to do your assignment and would pick 15 questions that were previously done for the exams. It was very simple and straightforward. I am horrible at it but this teacher really makes it easy.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: The class obviously has a lot of information but it's super easy. Everything is through ALEKS but he holds office hours every week to help out. Drops your lowest test grade and is super nice and helpful. Sends out weekly emails to remind about any upcoming assignments. Loved this class!!
Has office hours to help anyone with hw questions

Pretty good professor! I took Math 1111 online and the whole course was on ALEKs, but he will still host review sessions and answer any questions. There is a lot of homework every week and the first test is hard, but after that youll be fine. He replaces your lowest test grade with the final, which helped me a lot. I recommend taking this class!

If u know algebra 2 youll do fine (knowing how to factor is very important) 4 test (15 questions) and 4 study guides (30 questions). Final exam (25 questions) and a study guide (50 questions). Lot of homework but good easy class
Great teacher; if you put in the work this class should be an easy A.

Really helpful; he holds weekly office hours. They aren't mandatory but beneficial if you have any questions about the homework. I did, at times, feel like the workload was heavy towards the end of the semester, but I managed. I recommend taking this class.

The entire class is administered through ALEKS, with weekly homework assignments that arent too difficult to teach yourself. He also has optional zoom meetings if you need help on topics, and hell send them out to those who couldnt attend. All the tests are on lockdown browser.

Go at your own pace with deadlines every Wednesday or Sunday. Holds a Zoom meeting before every deadline/test to answer questions and work out problems. Uploads that video to D2L for those who couldn't attend. I had a death in my family, and the professor was extremely understanding and allowed me to retake a test I missed. Would recommend!

All of the assignments were completed on mcgraw hill. Each week had topics you had to finish with clear due dates and assigned knowledge checks. It does take some time to complete if you keep getting things wrong. It does require a webcam and lockdown browser. Super easy tests and he holds test sessions

We were really taught by the ALEKS platform but the professor did provide help if needed and would hold review sessions. The homework wasn't terrible and there were only 4 tests. Each test only had 15 questions. Each test had a review assigned along with it which had 30 questions and he would take 15 from the review and have those on the test.

This class was online and for the most part, he was not involved in teaching. We used Aleks all throughout the semester, however, before tests he holds review sessions where you can ask questions and he will show you how to do them. He's very patient and by far one of the best math teachers I've had.

An easy A as long as you show up and do the homework. Holtzendorff explains things well and makes them easy to understand, uses lots of examples. Class is graded on 4 test and a final, as well as weekly homework through Alecs and an attendance grade as well. He drops your lowest test grade and replaces it will the final if needed.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great professor for those who need math explained well to be good at it. He actually goes over a few topics each class period and then allows you to work on homework for the last half of class. This is a great class to fit into a schedule since you get to work on your homework while also getting attendance.

I would love to take him again if I could. He could explain topics in a very understanding manner. He was a very straightforward teacher. First half of the class was the lecture then the second half of the class was working on your assignments for the week. If you want an easy grade for math, take him.

Overall, Chris was a nice guy who is very accessible during office hours. During office hours, you can ask him absolutely any question that you may have. The only down side is having to study 50 topics and only 14 being on the test. That part sucks but he is a nice person. Attendance is mandatory . Definitel not an easy A , only if you work for it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He's good and it's not too hard.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: BEST ALGEBRA TEACHER EVER!!!! First 30 minutes of every class, he teaches the topics on the weeks homework, he gives the last 20 minutes to work on homework. His lectures are so clear and easy to understand. GO TO HIS LAB. He is so helpful and will answer any questions whenever you have them. Tests on online so you get your grade back right away.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: I took AP calc in high school and had to drop his class mid way through. He does 5 questions on the board in class then you have to figure the rest out on your own. A lot of homework and very rude in class. Also no study guides for tests.

I took honors pre-calc in highschool and got a 98. I . currently have a 73 in this class. The material is easy and he teaches well but all of it is online. You learn 60-80 topics each test and only 14 of those topics will be on test. He doesn't offer a study guide at all. Also he said if your late after one time he will mark you ABSENT.

Creates his own video lectures &works through several examples step by step. Explains things in a way that makes it much easier to understand than the textbook. Course organization is straightforward. Downside is all tests are in MyMathLab and it can be finicky about formatting . He gives partial credit back on that type of stuff if you reach out.

Great guy. Take him online. Used my MyMathLab/MyLabMath and it's super easy. The homework is easy and you have the chance to attempt each question 5 times and attempt each test twice. His lecture videos are a bit slow but you will understand the work completely. He emails back super fast and is very understanding. Makes math super easy.

best professor i've had at ksu so far. the ones giving poor reviews must have cheated or something. i just went to class and asked questions. don't cheat! there were a couple of people with cheat sheets last semester who got caught. yikes!

HW assignments are online. Make sure you do all the HW. His lectures were extremely fast-paced. Difficult to talk to. I would ask questions that wouldn't be directly answered. Know the content enough to where you feel like you can teach it. Tests are NOT multiple choice. Overall, he is a decent professor who will crack a joke every now-and-then.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: He's a good math teacher but it's definitely no easy A. The best thing to do is to get the book and do the practice questions. DO THE STUDY GUIDE! If you can show him that you put in effort he'll be more lenient with your grade.
He will treat you different if you dont show up. He has favorites and shows it.

Very good prof. Knows how to teach the material in ways that make sense. Does guided lectures. Gives plenty of examples for you to work on and has you print off notes to fill out in class. Will make you get MyMathLab to do homework but actually is very helpful/useful. Tests are straight from study guides and MML problems. Four tests and a final.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: There is quite a bit of homework, but the homework helps to understand the content better. He was literally AMAZING though, if youre not good at math this is the guy you want ! He has paper you print out for each unit that you fill in while he goes over the material in class. He goes over everything in such detail and is super helpful! Great teach

I loved Mr. Holtzendorff's class. He is a great Math professor. He teaches everything in a way that everyone can understand. He does talk to students like they're still in middle school sometimes, which is annoying, but he cares for the well-being of his students. 10/10 would recommend. I wish could take him again.

Professor Holtzendorff was an amazing teacher. He gives guided notes and his tests are very similar to the notes. You have to study to pass Homework isnt due till day of the test but dont procrastinate because it'll become a lot of work. Take him for College Algebra because he made my first semester in math easy and amazing

I have had to take calc 2 twice before taking it with him. I cannot say enough about him. I haven't had a teacher help me learn math like this since high school. He really goes through each step of the process and answers all questions. If you study the notes, do the hw, and review guide you'll pass. He also gives you a notecard! He's incredible!

I took Mr. Holtzendorff for an Education hybrid class and he was great! The class is not hard, and the assignments are all purposeful. As long as you do the field hours you will pass, and he is very understanding with any issues. Would take again!
I took Holtzendorff for my Education class. He's passionate about the class and does a good job at keeping students interested and on task
He's a great professor but you wont pass if you don't show up. leavy heavy. lots of homework. he can lose his temper very quickly especially if you are on your phone or you leave the room.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you have always struggled in math, then he is the perfect professor for you. He teaches at the perfect pace for anyone.
Great teacher, if you dont understand math at all and need help, you want to take him. he explains things like you are in kindergarten however it helps so much more than you would think.

I took him as a freshman and I have trouble with math. All he does is do the notes for you on the projector. He does answer questions but other than that you are left to do the homework and teach yourself. I recommend using the online textbook and studying a lot. His test are only 40 questions (sometimes less). I wouldn't take him if you need help.
Great teacher but test are a little difficult. He teaches everything in a way that everyone can understands and he is very approachable.
Sad he's moving into the education department. Great professor
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Great teacher. The guided notes he provides are great.  I wish I had taken him for Calc 1. I can't recommend him enough. He made Calc 2 during summer semester enjoyable.

He gives the best lectures and explains calculus in a way that makes it so much easier to understand. As long as you fill in his guided notes in class and do the homework (which is really not all that bad for Calc 2) you should do well easily. 10/10 best math teacher I've had so far in college.

He is by far the best professor I have ever had. He gives guided notes and goes through everything. You have to come to class new homework everyday after class and gives you till the next class, not difficult thought. If you go to his office an hour before a test he will personally go over what you didn't know in the review guide. LOVE HIM!!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Great professor
6 Tests, 1 Final, and some online homework. Best math professor I have ever had. Has guided notes that you can print out before each class. Does a great job at teaching the material. Easy A
You go to class everyday and fill in notes. Not hard but can get boring. Tests are straight forward and homework is short and easy.

Holtendorff has been the best professor I have EVER had at KSU! He is super helpful throughout the course and has guided notes that make the material way more easy to understand, along with his lectures. You can really tell that he loves what he does and cares for his students. Prepares you for success but you do have to work at it a bit. Take him!
rating_tags: CARES ABOUT STUDENTS--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Holtzendorff is definitely one of my favorite professors I've had in my 3 years of college. Super nice, realistic with class expectations, prepares you to ace every test, really accessible for extra help. Wish I could take him for every math class! Made calc II super interesting, enjoyable, and understanding!

This guy made Calc 2 easy to understand.  He gives guided notes that you can print off and bring to class for each lecture.  The notes are excellent and have tons of helpful examples.  Holds a study session the evening before the exam.  Tests are moderately difficult, don't ignore the final.  Also, don't skip class, its not easy to catch up

Took an 8-week course with him for MATH 2202, one of the more important ones for my major. He uploads guided notes a day or two before the lecture and uses them for his lecture. He is very thorough with his explanations so anyone can understand. His office hours and help sessions before big tests came in handy when I didn't understand something.

My opinion of Holtzendorff is biased because I took him for an 8 week Calc 2 session. However, he is very passionate and knowledgable about what he does and cares for individual students. Homework and example problems reappear on tests and the book wasn't used much except for extra work and clarification.
